item.description:
Our Starting Location TBD
Parade Starts at Broadway
South Boston, MA
Contact: When you RSVP, Wini supply you with her cell phone number

The more people we have the Greater the Impact we will make. Remember with the Martha Stewart Tall show, the Adrianne Cohen book and the Height & Weight Discrimination Bill Hearing that Cindy, Sue and Wini testified at, there has been a LOT of tall publicity lately and we will be noticed, so join us and make a Sea of Tall Green!!!!!

AGENDA
8:30 AM Breakfast Newcomb Farms Restaurant
31 Beale St., Quincy, MA 02170
(617) 472-9641

This is one block from the Wollaston “T” Stop and two blocks from my house. If you park at the Wollaston “T” stop it will cost you $3.00.
If you park on the street, it is free.

11:00 AM We need to be at the Parade grounds to line up by 11:00 AM.

After Parade: Following the Parade all Parade Participants are invited to a traditional Irish Feast at Sue Flynn’s Sister’s House in Quincy, MA. It's a lovely little house by the sea in Houghs Neck where we’ll be getting on the Green and enjoying some Corned Beef, Cabbage, Potatoes, Beverages and all the trimmings of the day. When you RSVP, please indicate if you'll be staying for the after party so we can pass your name along to Miss Tall Boston and her sister so they can plan for food. The address and directions will be provided at the parade.
item.name: BBTC Annual St Pat's Parade
